newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Zwack Q1 exports hit by end on CIS sales.
newsitem.headline: Zwack Q1 exports hit by end on CIS sales.

text.p: Hungarian spirits maker Zwack Unicum Rt on Thursday reported its IAS group pre-tax profits rising two percent to 87 million forints in the first quarter of 1997 amid an almost 60 percent fall in exports.

"The group does not continue the export of cheap products to the countries of Commonwealth of Independent States, therefore our export revenues fell 59.7 percent from the same period of 1996," Zwack said in its earnings report. It did not say why exports had stopped.

The group reported its gross sales falling to 2.82 billion forints in the first quarter of 1997 from 2.965 billion in the first three months of 1996, but gave no details on exports and domestic sales. Net sales revenues amounted to 1.72 billion.
"The group's net sales revenues and its pre-tax profit was in line with its 1997 business plan," Zwack said.
